PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE — * Since the NAEB is the sole professional
association in the area of educational broadcasting, it is incumbent upon it
to assume responsibility for the maximum professional and educational develop¬
ment of radio and television as educational instruments* The achievement of
this goal depends almost entirely upon the caliber and qualifications of the
responsible personnel* The maintenance and improvement of standards depend
upon an organized program for professional advancement* Such a program must
be long-range* It must be current, far seeing and flexible* It must include
opportunities ranging from the improvement of skills to the re-thinking of
basic philosophies. It must provide opportunities for both recognition and
advancement* It must develop leadership* Such a program depends upon dif¬
ferent types of approaches: Centralized, on-going services must be provided,
as in the case of continuing placement, engineering, and other assistance;
where mechanisms do not exist elsewhere, the NAEB must itself operate intensive
workshops and seminars; to meet individual needs not otherwise provided for,
scholarships, consultation, and other more flexible types of support must be
provided; and always there must be constant review and evaluation* (The fore¬
going is from a "Statement of Purpose and Objectives" developed by the NAEB
Professional Advancement Committee, which exists to advise the President and
Board on the matters listed, and to suggest specific steps to be taken, and
means to implement them*)
PUBLIC RELATIONS COMMITTEE — This committee is charged with general PR res¬
ponsibility; it should remain sensitive to the Association’s current PR posi¬
tion and provide guidance, constructive criticisms and suggestions for the
Association’s PR operations* This committee advises the President and Editor
on all such matters and is expected to recommend activities ranging from day-
to-day "publicity" to long-range promotional goals*
PUBLICATIONS COMMITTEE — Primary responsibility shall be that of the overall
policy and co-ordination of the NAEB Journal and the NAEB Newsletter* In this
respect the committee shall function as advisory to the President and Managing
Editor. Also, the committee shall assist in the preparation and procurement
of materials for publication in the Jcarnal and Newsletter. The committee,
shall also advise the President and Managing Editor with regard to other NAEB
publications when such advice is requested, or seems desirable by the com-
mittee, ( Revised February 6, I960.)
RADIO NETWORK COMMITTEE — This committee is directly responsible for the
selection of programs to be distributed by the NAEB Radio Network, other than
in-school programs. In addition, this committee advises the President and
Network Manager on matters pertaining to the NAEB Network, and conducts research
both on its own initiative and at the request of the President or the Network
Manager (such as the questionnaire designed to determine subscribers’ opinions
regarding the Network and its operation, a study of the program service pursuant
to establishing a realistic cost figure for every program distributed by the
Network, etc).
RADIO NETWORK SCHOOL COMMITTEE — This committee has the same responsibilities
regarding in-school programs as enumerate above for the Radio Network Committee
